title: Love it, but waiting for features
text: Lots of great features from the other versions would be great if those were added I will improve my review.

title: Works
text: This Succeeded in reducing my screen time / media consumptions. Delay feature, scheduled blocks feature, and also explicit content blocker.

title: saved my life
text: i can control my screen time - iâ€™m not the type to scroll mindlessly. however what i couldnâ€™t control was manically checking my exâ€™s social media eighty times a day. this app cut that nonsense out almost instantaneously and saved my sanity (not even exaggerating)

title: Way too expensive
text: I mean cmon, $100 to use the app with more than just instagram? Wth? Why do I gotta pay you $100 to limit other apps on my phone. I know thatâ€™s the point of the app, but dawg. $100? No thanks

title: Awesome app
text: It really works, and it doesn't sell your data.

title: Great App! Could be more strict
text: Great app to just make you reconsider opening Instagram for the 5th time in a row. Not great for permanently blocking apps since you can easily bypass a manual block session, even with Pro.

title: Too sensitive sometimes.
text: Itâ€™s a great app. But it triggered too easily. I sometimes want to turn off dnd or something in the control center and re triggered it. If intential app switching is going to be under the pro version, then at least allow small out of app access like using flashlight or accessing control center to not trigger the automation. Since the app worked the way it needed to, Iâ€™m going to delete it because itâ€™s now becoming unusable for me

title: Doesnâ€™t do what I wanted
text:
App blocking is buggy and inconsistent, especially if you want to lock your phone down and only get access to a few apps.

Can only schedule blocks on a whole hour.

Despite the fact that I paid for a whole year of access, Iâ€™ll be looking for a different app blocking option.

title: Underrated App
text:
I love the price and great privacy policy compared to other similar apps. Thereâ€™s also so many features that other apps donâ€™t have, specifically the main feature of adding an intervention to an app. The developer(s?) have also added blocks, filters, re-interventions, etc over the years. 

For the price, even as a subscription this app is worth it easily. 

The one issue Iâ€™ve had recently is that some apps Iâ€™ve added donâ€™t seem to immediately be recognized for an intervention. It seems to eventually get sorted out but lately (maybe since around ios26 release?) itâ€™s been a recurring issue. 

All of that said, this is still for me the best screen time app out there especially for the price. Highly recommend it and am always unsure how/why more folks in the digital detox space donâ€™t talk about this app a lot more.

title: Good, but could be better
text: Good app, serves its purpose really well, but I would really enjoy an extra app or two if blocking on the free version, two apps would really help a lot of people

title: Love it
text:
Bought this app years ago and find myself using it, taking breaks, and coming back again. 

Favorite use for it is for a total block before bed and in the mornings to stop checking socials. 

Donâ€™t use it for more than that as I want to check my socials for work. The use case Iâ€™d love it for is a time specific allowance. For example every hour you have two minutes to check Instagram if youâ€™d like and then your cut off for an hour. Just enough time to check if you have important messages and maybe extend once to reply then get back to life.

title: Youâ€™ll eventually bypass it
text: This is a little tricky to set up and you will eventually bypass it just like you do screen time limits or other similar rules. Unless youâ€™re very strict with yourself, it becomes just another nuisance (which actually is the point). I do like that it is highly customizable and that they track how much time youâ€™ve saved by using the app (itâ€™s motivating).

title: Strong blocking, but missing real accountability
text:
This app does a good job enforcing Screen Time limits, but it falls short as an accountability tool.

Like most Screen Time apps, it relies on three mechanisms:
	â€¢	app time limits
	â€¢	unlocks / temporary access
	â€¢	scheduled blocks

The problem is that following or breaking these rules isnâ€™t meaningfully tracked. Users can:
	â€¢	repeatedly use unlocks
	â€¢	change limits or schedules after enforcement starts
	â€¢	revoke Screen Time permissions and re-enable later

â€¦without any persistent history or consequence inside the app. That makes it easy to undermine your own rules quietly, which defeats the purpose for serious users.

What would make this a 5-star app:
	â€¢	an accountability history (unlock usage, schedule adherence, rule changes)
	â€¢	logging Screen Time permission revocations/restores
	â€¢	an integrity metric (did I keep my word or not)
	â€¢	brief, optional reflection prompts at key moments (before unlocks, after rule changes)
	â€¢	weekly summaries focused on accountability, not just usage minutes
	â€¢	a place to define and revisit why youâ€™re limiting apps, so behavior change is internal, not just enforced

Blocking alone changes behavior temporarily.
Accountability, integrity tracking, and reflection change it long-term.

If these additions were made, this would easily be a 5-star app.

title: They got greedy
text: Now they demand you to pay if you want to use it for more than one app. Shameless greedy developers

title: Not a scam
text: For once a reliable app that doesnâ€™t cost a monthly fee lol

title: Love it.. but..
text: Fantastic app. My biggest gripe is that the app itself gets in the way when switching apps. Every time you open an app, it also opens one sec, which always keeps it front row in the app switcher. It would be nice if tapping the appâ€™s name opened the app directly.

title: Amazing
text: They made it so you canâ€™t delete the app during strict block, which I kept doing whenever I got real desperate to check my social apps. Itâ€™s sad lol. Thank you making this feature. Best app!

title: Amazing
text: Finally Iâ€™m making progress with combating mindless scrolling and breaking the bad habit of bad websites. Game changer for my business productivity

title: Only works with one app unless you pay
text: You canâ€™t set up extra apps unless you get pro.

title: It's alright
text: I can't select minutes when to start the app restriction and that's frustrating because for example I want to set the restriction on 9:30 but the app gives you only 9:00 or 10:00 and so on

title: Massive Screen Time Reduction
text: This app has reduced my scroll time from 3-4 hours a day to under 1 hour! Customizability is fantastic, I only wish I could set the app to automatically enter a sticky block after Iâ€™ve used an app for a certain amount of time in a day, or really any app limiting feature.

title: Doesnâ€™t actually open the app for the time you set
text: I like this app in concept, i like the breathing feature and stuff. Theres just one problem. if i open an app and set it to only, 5 mins for example, itâ€™ll stretch out WAY beyond that. on my last test it went all the way to 15. I'm accidentally using the apps for way longer. Literally defeating the entire purpose of downloading.

title: Life changing!!!
text: Legit life changing app if you are addicted to social media like many of us are! Took my social media screen time from over 11 hours per week to under 1 in two months!

title: why do i have to pay
text: i recently redownloaded one sec after having it deleted for a while and was really disappointed to see that now i have to pay to have more than one app restrict usage. before i had three to four apps i could stop from going on. now i cant do that which is a shame since it was very helpful before

title: Awesome App - Thoughtfully Made
text: Some apps block you from completely accessing certain apps or websites. This forces you to be intentional about wanting to go onto them. I love the reinterventions, and forcing you to say how much time you want to spend before you go in, so you donâ€™t look up at have 1 hour gone. Awesome app, best $20 Iâ€™ve ever spent. I use both the iPhone app and the chrome extension.

title: App needs update
text: Something happened to your formatting that makes it so the words are cut off at the top by the phone camera bar and you can barely read them. Skip is so cut off that itâ€™s not even clickable.

title: Best Feature No Longer Works
text: I only used this app for the phone free morning feature, now that apple has removed the ability to detect when you wake up without an Apple Watch, the app is useless to me. Not onesecs fault, if they can find another way to implement it I would happily redownload

title: Spectacular
text: This app makes me so mad. Super effective and saves so much time.

title: Being productive
text:
Being productive is not easy I am currently looking for my way to show productivity. And those plugins and exteiosn show the result 

The app is not there yet in terms of work on Mac OS but I believe itâ€™s getting there.
